name: symphyotrichum turbinellum
description: A native of dry-mesic prairies and savannas, Symphyotricum turbinellum is one of the later-blooming Asters. It grows 1 1/2 to 3' tall and is generally erect, occasionally branching laterally.  It produces compact blossoms 3/4" or larger in diameter, each with 15-25 lavender-purple ray petals surrounding a yellow to reddish-purple center.   Other common name: Turbinate Aster Other botanical name: Aster turbinellus
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
